Package net.objectzoo.delegates.impl

Class AsyncExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.objectzoo.delegates.impl.AsyncExecutor
  • public class AsyncExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a helper class that is used for the asynchronous invocation of actions and functions.

    An Executor is used for the asynchronous invocations. The Executor to be used is determined with the following steps.

    1. The Executor given at construction time is used.

    2. The default Executor that has been set is used.

    3. A new default Executor is created and used.

    The default Executor automatically created by this AsyncExecutor is a ThreadPoolExecutor with at most one single @ Thread} working at the asynchronous operations and an unbounded LinkedBlockingQueue as backend storage. This guarantees that all asynchronous invocation are performed one after each other in the order that they have been queued and bears the risk of a OutOfMemoryError if permanently new asynchronous invocations are queued faster than they can be completed by a single Thread.

    Author:
    tilmann

      Constructors

      AsyncExecutor()

    • Constructor Detail

      • AsyncExecutor

        public AsyncExecutor()
        Creates a new AsyncExecutor that uses the default Executor for asynchronous exection. The default Executor can be set using the setDefaultExecutor(Executor) property.

      • AsyncExecutor

        public AsyncExecutor​(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
        Creates a new AsyncExecutor that uses the given Executor for asynchronous execution. If null is given the default Executor is used.
        Parameters:
        executor - the Executor used for asynchronous execution

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultExecutor

        public static java.util.concurrent.Executor getDefaultExecutor()
        Retrkieves the default Executor creating a new one of none has been set or created before.
        Returns:
        the default Executor

      • setDefaultExecutor

        public static void setDefaultExecutor​(java.util.concurrent.Executor defaultExecutor)
        Sets the default Executor
        Parameters:
        defaultExecutor - the new default Executor

      • execute

        public <R> FunctionAsyncResult<R> execute​(java.util.function.Supplier<R> callableSupplier,
                                          java.util.function.Consumer<? super FunctionAsyncResult<R>> callback,
                                          java.lang.Object asyncState)
        Executes the given Callable asynchronously, creates a FunctionAsyncResult and takes care of calling the given Consumer as required by the specification of FunctionAsync.beginApply(Consumer, Object, Object).
        Type Parameters:
        R - the return value type of the Callable
        Parameters:
        callableSupplier - the Supplier to be called to carry out the invocation and to obtain the return value
        callback - the callback to be called when the asynchronous invocation has finished
        asyncState - the asynchronous state object to be used in the asynchronous result
        Returns:
        the asynchronous result object for the invocation

                                 java.util.function.Consumer<ActionAsyncResult> callback,
                                 java.lang.Object asyncState)
